trans-unit.source: Collects all errors generated by the .NET Framework Data Provider for OLE DB.
This class cannot be inherited.
This class is created by <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbException> to collect instances of the <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbError> class.
<xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbErrorCollection> always contains at least one instance of the <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbError> class.

Copies the elements of the <xref href="System.Data.OleDb.OleDbErrorCollection"></xref> into an <xref href="System.Array"></xref>, starting at the specified index within the <xref href="System.Array"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> into which to copy the elements.
The starting index of the array.
The sum of index and the number of elements in the is greater than the length of the .
The array is `null`.
The index is not valid for array.

Copies all the elements of the current <xref href="System.Data.OleDb.OleDbErrorCollection"></xref> to the specified <xref href="System.Data.OleDb.OleDbErrorCollection"></xref> starting at the specified destination index.
The <xref href="System.Data.OleDb.OleDbErrorCollection"></xref> that is the destination of the elements copied from the current <xref href="System.Data.OleDb.OleDbErrorCollection"></xref>.
A 32-bit integer that represents the index in the <xref href="System.Data.OleDb.OleDbErrorCollection"></xref> at which copying starts.
Gets the number of errors in the collection.
The total number of errors in the collection.
Exposes the <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator"></xref> method, which supports a simple iteration over a collection by a .NET Framework data provider.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Gets the error at the specified index.
The following example displays each <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbError> within the <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbErrorCollection> collection.
The zero-based index of the error to retrieve.
An <xref href="System.Data.OleDb.OleDbError"></xref> that contains the error at the specified index.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbErrorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`true` if access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbErrorCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
A <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
